title: DirectX Error
body: Game would crash upon launch. Initiated full client repair; didn't fix the problem. Reinstalled League of Legends on my computer in D:, still doesn't launch.

replies.body:
DirectX error usually happens when there are one or more files missing inside your DirectX directories. You should be able to resolve this by running all available Windows Updates and then install all available packages with the [**DirectX Web Installer.**](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35)

Let me know if this helped.

Ran Windows Update and DirectX Web Installer. Got feedback saying that a newer or equivalent version of DirectX has been found. Game still crashes, however.

I'm thinking that I should not have reinstalled League on my D: Drive. At the time, I did it because my C: drive was almost full, but now I'm wondering if adding another variable is making the situation more complicated.
heres what worked for me, i did [windows key],X and then [device manager]>display adapters, then if you have two, disable the nvidia one, or whichever one isnt intel
